Source code for omegaml.backends.genai.pgvector

  1import json
  2import re
  3from pgvector.sqlalchemy import Vector
  4from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String, text, ForeignKey, select, Index
  5from sqlalchemy.engine import RowMapping
  6from sqlalchemy.orm import Session, relationship
  7
  8from omegaml.backends.genai.index import VectorStoreBackend
  9
 10


[docs]
 11class PGVectorBackend(VectorStoreBackend):
 12    """
 13    docker run pgvector/pgvector:pg16
 14    """
 15    KIND = 'pgvector.conx'
 16    PROMOTE = 'metadata'
 17
 18    @classmethod
 19    def supports(cls, obj, name, insert=False, data_store=None, model_store=None, *args, **kwargs):
 20        return _is_valid_url(obj)  # or data_store.exists(name)
 21
 22    def insert_chunks(self, chunks, name, embeddings, attributes, **kwargs):
 23        collection, vector_size, model = self._get_collection(name)
 24        Document, Chunk = self._create_collection(name, collection, vector_size, **kwargs)
 25        Session = self._get_connection(name, session=True)
 26        with Session as session:
 27            source = (attributes or {}).pop('source', None)
 28            source = str(source) if source else ''
 29            attributes = json.dumps(attributes or {})
 30            doc = Document(source=source, attributes=attributes)
 31            session.add(doc)
 32            for text, embedding in zip(chunks, embeddings):
 33                chunk = Chunk(document=doc, text=text, embedding=embedding)
 34                session.add(chunk)
 35            session.commit()
 36
 37    def list(self, name):
 38        """
 39        List all documents inside a collections
 40        """
 41        collection, vector_size, model = self._get_collection(name)
 42        Document, Chunk = self._create_collection(name, collection, vector_size)
 43        Session = self._get_connection(name, session=True)
 44        data = []
 45        with Session as session:
 46            query = (select(Document.id,
 47                            Document.source,
 48                            Document.attributes)
 49                     .order_by(Document.source))
 50            result = session.execute(query)
 51            data = list(result.mappings().all())
 52        return data
 53
 54    def find_similar(self, name, obj, top=5, filter=None, distance=None, **kwargs):
 55        collection, vector_size, model = self._get_collection(name)
 56        Document, Chunk = self._create_collection(name, collection, vector_size)
 57        Session = self._get_connection(name, session=True)
 58        METRIC_MAP = {
 59            'l2': lambda target: Chunk.embedding.l2_distance(target),
 60            'cos': lambda target: Chunk.embedding.cosine_distance(target),
 61        }
 62        metric = distance or 'l2'
 63        with Session as session:
 64            distance_fn = METRIC_MAP[metric]
 65            chunks = (select(Document.id,
 66                             Document.source,
 67                             Document.attributes,
 68                             Chunk.text,
 69                             # Chunk.embedding,
 70                             distance_fn(obj).label('distance'))
 71                      .join(Chunk.document)
 72                      .order_by(distance))
 73            if isinstance(top, int) and top > 0:
 74                chunks = chunks.limit(top)
 75            results = session.execute(chunks)
 76            data = list(results.mappings().all())
 77        return data
 78
 79    def embeddings(self, name):
 80        """
 81        List all embeddings inside a collection
 82        """
 83        collection, vector_size, model = self._get_collection(name)
 84        Document, Chunk = self._create_collection(name, collection, vector_size)
 85        Session = self._get_connection(name, session=True)
 86        data = []
 87        with Session as session:
 88            query = (select(Chunk.id,
 89                            Chunk.text,
 90                            Chunk.embedding,
 91                            Document.source,
 92                            Document.attributes)
 93                     .join(Chunk.document)
 94                     .order_by(Document.source))
 95            result = session.execute(query)
 96            data = list(result.mappings().all())
 97        return data
 98
 99    def delete(self, name, obj=None, filter=None, **kwargs):
100        collection, vector_size, model = self._get_collection(name)
101        Document, Chunk = self._create_collection(name, collection, vector_size, **kwargs)
102        Session = self._get_connection(name, session=True)
103        with Session as session:
104            # get documents
105            if isinstance(obj, (dict, RowMapping)):
106                docs_query = select(Document.id).where(Document.id == obj['id'])
107            elif isinstance(obj, int):
108                docs_query = select(Document.id).where(Document.id == obj)
109            elif isinstance(obj, str):
110                docs_query = select(Document.id).where(Document.source == obj)
111            else:
112                docs_query = select(Document.id)
113            doc_ids = session.execute(docs_query).scalars().all()
114            if doc_ids:
115                session.query(Chunk).filter(Chunk.document_id.in_(doc_ids)).delete(synchronize_session='fetch')
116                session.query(Document).filter(Document.id.in_(doc_ids)).delete(synchronize_session='fetch')
117            session.commit()
118
119    def _create_collection(self, name, collection, vector_size, **kwargs):
120        from sqlalchemy.orm import declarative_base
121        Base = declarative_base()
122        collection = collection or self._default_collection(name)
123        docs_table = f'{collection}_docs'
124        chunks_table = f'{docs_table}_chunks'
125
126        class Document(Base):
127            __tablename__ = docs_table
128            id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True)
129            source = Column(String)
130            attributes = Column(String)
131
132        class Chunk(Base):
133            __tablename__ = chunks_table
134
135            id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True)
136            text = Column(String)
137            embedding = Column(Vector(vector_size))
138            document_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey(f'{docs_table}.id'))
139            document = relationship('Document')
140
141        with self._get_connection(name, session=True) as session:
142            session.execute(text('CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS vector'))
143            session.commit()
144            Base.metadata.create_all(session.get_bind())
145            session.commit()
146        with self._get_connection(name, session=True) as session:
147            try:
148                index = Index(
149                    'l2_index',
150                    Chunk.embedding,
151                    postgresql_using='hnsw',
152                    postgresql_with={'m': 16, 'ef_construction': 64},
153                    postgresql_ops={'embedding': 'vector_l2_ops'}
154                )
155                index.create(session.get_bind())
156            except Exception as e:
157                pass
158            session.commit()
159        return Document, Chunk
160
161    def _get_connection(self, name, session=False):
162        from sqlalchemy import create_engine
163        meta = self.data_store.metadata(name)
164        connection_str = meta.kind_meta['connection']
165        connection_str = connection_str.replace('pgvector', 'postgresql').replace('sqla+', '')
166        import sqlalchemy
167        # https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/changelog/migration_20.html
168        kwargs = {} if sqlalchemy.__version__.startswith('2.') else dict(future=True)
169        engine = create_engine(connection_str, **kwargs)
170        if session:
171            connection = Session(bind=engine)
172        else:
173            connection = engine.connect()
174        return connection


175
176
177def _is_valid_url(url):
178    return isinstance(url, str) and re.match(r'(sqla\+)?pgvector://', str(url))
